title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: William Morris, one of the most eminent imaginative writers of the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Victorian age, differs from most other poets and men of letters in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: two ways--first, he did great work in many other things as well as in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: literature; secondly, he had beliefs of his own about the meaning and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: conduct of life, about all that men think and do and make, very
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: different from those of ordinary people, and he carried out these
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: views in his writings as well as in all the other work he did
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: throughout his life.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: He was born in 1834. His father, a member of a business firm in the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: City of London, was a wealthy man and lived in Essex, in a country
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: house with large gardens and fields belonging to it, on the edge of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Epping Forest. Until the age of thirteen Morris was at home among a
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: large family of brothers and sisters. He delighted in the country
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: life and especially in the Forest, which is one of the most romantic
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: parts of England, and which he made the scene of many real and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: imaginary adventures. From fourteen to eighteen he was at school at
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Marlborough among the Wiltshire downs, in a country full of beauty and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: history, and close to another of the ancient forests of England, that
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of Savernake. He proceeded from school to Exeter College, Oxford,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: where he soon formed a close friendship with a remarkable set of young
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: men of his own age; chief among these, and Morris's closest friend for
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the rest of his life, was Edward Burne-Jones, the painter. Study of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the works of John Ruskin confirmed them in the admiration which they
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: already felt for the life and art of the Middle Ages. In the summer
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: vacation of 1855 the two friends went to Northern France to see the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: beautiful towns and splendid churches with which that country had been
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: filled between the eleventh and the fifteenth centuries; and there
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: they made up their minds that they cared for art more than for
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: anything else, such as wealth or ease or the opinion of the world,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and that as soon as they left Oxford they would become artists.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: By art they meant the making of beauty for the adornment and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: enrichment of human life, and as artists they meant to strive against
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: all that was ugly or mean or untruthful in the life of their own time.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Art, as they understood it, is one single thing covering the whole
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of life but practised in many special forms that differ one from
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: another. Among these many forms of art there are two of principal
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: importance. One of the two is the art which is concerned with the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: making and adorning of the houses in which men and women live; that is
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: to say, architecture, with all its attendant arts of decoration,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: including sculpture, painting, the designing and ornamenting of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: metal, wood and glass, carpets, paper-hangings, woven, dyed and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: embroidered cloths of all kinds, and all the furniture which a house
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: may have for use or pleasure. The other is the art which is concerned
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: with the making and adorning of stories in prose and verse. Both of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: these kinds of art were practised by Morris throughout his life. The
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: former was his principal occupation; he made his living by it, and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: built up in it a business which alone made him famous, and which has
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: had a great influence towards bringing more beauty into daily domestic
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: life in England and in other countries also. His profession was thus
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: that of a manufacturer, designer, and decorator. When he had to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: describe himself by a single word, he called himself a designer. But
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: it is the latter branch of his art which principally concerns us now,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the art of a maker and adorner of stories. He became famous in this
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: kind of art also, both in prose and verse, as a romance-writer and a
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: poet. But he spoke of it as play rather than work, and although he
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: spent much time and great pains on it, he regarded it as relaxation
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: from the harder and more constant work of his life, which was carrying
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: on the business of designing, painting, weaving, dyeing, printing and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: other occupations of that kind. In later life he also gave much of his
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: time to political and social work, with the object of bringing back
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: mankind into a path from which they had strayed since the end of the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Middle Ages, and creating a state of society in which art, by the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: people and for the people, a joy to the maker and the user, might be
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: naturally, easily, and universally produced.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Even as a boy Morris had been noted for his love of reading and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: inventing tales; but he did not begin to write any until he had been
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: for a couple of years at Oxford. His earliest poems and his earliest
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: written prose tales belong to the same year, 1855, in which he
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: determined to make art his profession. The first of either that he
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: published appeared in the Oxford and Cambridge Magazine, which was
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: started and managed by him and his friends in 1856. In 1858, after he
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: had left Oxford, he brought out a volume of poems called, after the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: title of the first poem in the book, "The Defence of Guenevere." Soon
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: afterwards he founded, with some of his old Oxford friends and others
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: whom he had made in London, among whom Dante Gabriel Rossetti was the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: leading spirit, the firm of Morris and Company, manufacturers and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: decorators. His business, in which he was the principal and finally
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the sole partner, took up the main part of his time. He had also
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: married, and built himself a beautiful small house in Kent, the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: decoration of which went busily on for several years. Among all these
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: other occupations he almost gave up writing stories, but never ceased
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: reading and thinking about them. In 1865 he came back to live in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: London, where, being close to his work, he had more leisure for other
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: things; and between 1865 and 1870 he wrote between thirty and forty
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: tales in verse, containing not less than seventy or eighty thousand
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: lines in all. The longest of these tales, "The Life and Death of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Jason," appeared in 1867. It is the old Greek story of the ship Argo
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and the voyage in quest of the Golden Fleece. Twenty-five other tales
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: are included in "The Earthly Paradise," published in three parts
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: between 1868 and 1870.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: During these years Morris learned Icelandic, and his next published
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: works were translations of some of the Icelandic sagas, writings
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: composed from six to nine hundred years ago, and containing a mass of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: legends, histories and romances finely told in a noble language. These
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: translations were followed in 1876 by his great epic poem, "Sigurd the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Volsung and the Fall of the Niblungs." In that poem he retold a story
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of which an Icelandic version, the "Volsunga Saga," written in the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: twelfth century, is one of the world's masterpieces. It is the great
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: epic of Northern Europe, just as the "Iliad" and "Odyssey" of Homer
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: are the chief epics of ancient Greece, and the "AEneid" of Virgil the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: chief epic of the Roman Empire. Morris's love for these great stories
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of ancient times led him to rewrite the tale of the Volsungs and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Niblungs, which he reckoned the finest of them all, more fully and on
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: a larger scale than it had ever been written before. He had already,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: in 1875, translated the "AEneid" into verse, and some ten years later,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: in 1886-87, he also made a verse translation of the "Odyssey." In 1873
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: he had also written another very beautiful poem, "Love is Enough,"
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: containing the story of three pairs of lovers, a countryman and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: country-woman, an emperor and empress, and a prince and peasant girl.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: This poem was written in the form of a play, not of a narrative.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: To write prose was at first for Morris more difficult than to write
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: poetry. Verse came naturally to him, and he composed in prose only
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: with much effort until after long practice. Except for his early tales
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: in the Oxford and Cambridge Magazine and his translations of Icelandic
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: sagas, he wrote little but poetry until the year 1882. About that time
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: he began to give lectures and addresses, and wrote them in great
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: numbers during the latter part of his life. A number of them were
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: collected and published in two volumes called "Hopes and Fears for
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Art" and "Signs of Change," and many others have been published
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: separately. He thus gradually accustomed himself to prose composition.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For several years he was too busy with other things, which he thought
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: more important, to spend time on storytelling; but his instinct forced
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: itself out again, and in 1886 he began the series of romances in prose
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: or in mixed prose and verse which went on during the next ten years.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: The chief of these are, "A Dream of John Ball," "The House of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Wolfings," "The Roots of the Mountains," "News from Nowhere," "The
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Glittering Plain," "The Wood beyond the World," "The Well at the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: World's End," "The Water of the Wondrous Isles," and "The Sundering
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Flood." During the same years he also translated, out of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Icelandic and old French books, more of the stories which he had
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: long known and admired. "The Sundering Flood" was written in his last
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: illness, and finished by him within a few days of his death, in the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: autumn of 1896.

text: INTRODUCTION TO SIGURD
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: By The Editors
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: The story of Sigurd is important to English people not only for its
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: wondrous beauty, but also on account of its great age, and of what it
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: tells us about our own Viking ancestors, who first knew the story.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: The tale was known all over the north of Europe, in Denmark, in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Germany, in Norway and Sweden, and in Iceland, hundreds of years
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: before it was written down. Sometimes different names were given to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the characters, sometimes the events of the story were slightly
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: altered, but in the main points it was one and the same tale.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: If we look at a map of Europe showing the nations as they were rather
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: more than a thousand years ago, we see the names of Saxons, Goths,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Danes, and Frisians marked on the lands around the Baltic Sea. Those
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: who bore these names were the makers of the tale of Sigurd. The name
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of the Saxons is, of course, the best known to us, and next in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: importance come the people we call Danes, or Northmen, or Vikings, who
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: attacked the coasts of the Saxon kingdoms in England. The Saxons came
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: from part of the land that is now known as Germany, and the Vikings
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: from Denmark and from Scandinavia.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: A third important tribe was that of the Goths, who dwelt first in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: South Sweden, and then in Germany.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: All these people resembled one another in their way of life, in their
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: religion, and in their ideas of what deeds were good and what were
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: evil. Their lands were barren--too mountainous or too cold to bring
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: forth fruitful crops, and their homes were not such as would tempt men
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: never to leave them. So, though they built their little groups of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: wooden houses in the valleys of their lands, and made fields and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: pastures about them, these were often left to the care of the women
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and the feeble men, while the strong men made raids over the sea to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: other countries, where they engaged in the fighting which they loved,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and whence they brought back plunder to their homes. North, South,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: East, and West they went, till few parts of Europe had not learnt to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: know and fear them.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Their ships were long and narrow, driven often by oars as well as
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: sails, and outside them, along the bulwarks, the crew hung their round
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: shields made of yellow wood from the lime-tree. The men wore byrnies
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: or breast-plates, and helmets, and they were armed with swords, long
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: spears, or heavy battle-axes. They were enemies none could afford to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: despise, for they had great stature and strength of body, joined to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: such fierceness and delight in war that they held a man disgraced if
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: he died peacefully at home. Moreover, they knew nothing of mercy to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the conquered.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Courage, not only to fight, but also to bear suffering without
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: impatience or complaint, and the virtue of faithfulness were the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: qualities they most honoured. To be wanting in courage was disgraceful
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: in their eyes, but it was equally disgraceful to refuse to help
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: kinsfolk, to lie, to deceive, or to desert a chief.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: If they put their enemies to death with fearful tortures, they did not
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: treat them more severely than the traitors they discovered among
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: themselves, and if they had no pity for those they conquered, yet they
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: knew well how to admire great leaders, and how to serve them
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: faithfully. But we can best realise their ideas on these matters by
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: considering their religion and their stories.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: They worshipped one chief god, Odin, and other gods and goddesses who
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: were his children. Odin was often called All-father because he was the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: helper and friend of human beings, and appeared on earth in the form
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of an old man, "one-eyed and seeming ancient," with cloud-blue hood
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and grey cloak. He had courage, strength, and wondrous wisdom, for he
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: knew all events that happened in the world, and he understood the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: speech of birds, and all kinds of charms and magic arts. Men served
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: him by brave fighting in a good cause, and when they perished in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: battle he received their souls in his dwelling of Valhalla in the city
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of Asgard, where they spent each day in warfare, and where at evening
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the dead were revived, the wounded healed, and all feasted together in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Odin's palace. There they fed upon the flesh of the boar Saehrimner,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: which was renewed as fast as it was eaten. Certain maidens called
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Valkyrie, or Choosers of the Slain, were Odin's messengers whom he
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: sent forth into the battles of the world to find the warriors whom he
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: had appointed to die, and to bring them to Valhalla.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: In the story of Sigurd Odin has a very important part to play, but
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: for the understanding of the tale it is necessary to know something
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: about another of the gods. This is Loki, who, though sprung from the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: race of the giants, yet lived with the sons of Odin in Asgard,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: behaving sometimes as their trusty helper, but more often as their
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: cunning enemy. He caused much wretchedness, not only among the gods,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: but on earth also, for he delighted in the sight of misery. His vices
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: were all those most hateful to the Norse people, for he was before
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: all things a liar, a deceiver, a faith-breaker, a skilful worker of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: mischief by guile instead of by fair fight. There are many stories of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: his cunning thefts, of the miseries he wrought among his companions,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and of his envy of the beloved god Balder, whom he slew by a trick.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: His children were terrible monsters, as hated as himself. Yet,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: strange to say, Loki was Odin's companion in many of his adventures.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: The gods inhabited Asgard, a city standing on a high mountain in the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: middle of the world. Odin's palace of Valhalla was there, and other
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: palaces for his sons and daughters. All round Asgard lay Midgard, or
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the ordinary world of men and women. Its caves and waste places were
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: inhabited by dwarfs, whom Odin had banished from the light of day for
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: various ill deeds. They were a spiteful and cunning race, jealous of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: mankind, and eager to recover their lost power. Their strength lay in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: their wondrous skill in handicraft, for they could forge more deadly
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: weapons, and fashion more lovely jewels than any made by the hands of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: men. But, though possessed of wisdom, they had no spirit of kindness,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: no respect for right, and no dislike of wrong.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Around Midgard lay the sea, and beyond that Utgard, a hideous frozen
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: country inhabited by giants, enemies of the gods.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But this arrangement of the world was only for a season. The gods
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: themselves looked forward to a time of defeat and death, when Asgard
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: should perish in flames and the world with it, and the sun and moon
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: should be darkened, and they themselves should be slain. This great
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: day was called Ragnarok, or sometimes the Twilight of the Gods. Then
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Loki would gather giants and monsters to a great battle against the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: gods, who would slay their enemies, but who would themselves fall in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the struggle. The sea would drown the earth, the stars would fall,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and all things would pass away.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: This terrible fate the gods awaited with calm and cheerfulness,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: showing even greater courage than in their many deeds of war. They
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: had to submit to this fate, for there were three beings even greater
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: than they. These were the Norns, deciders of the fate of gods and men
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: alike. They were three giant maidens who dwelt by a sacred,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: wisdom-giving fountain, and who controlled the lives of men, giving
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: to each sickness and health, success and failure and death when they
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: would. No man or god might escape what the Norns decreed for him.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Many stories of these gods, together with tales of famous men, were
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: told among the northern peoples. These stories were passed on from
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: one to another by word of mouth, till they grew much longer and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: fuller, and the happening of certain historical events helped to take
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: them from country to country.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As we have seen, all the races of the North were warlike and eager
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: for adventure, and so when trouble came upon them in their own homes,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: they readily took to the sea to plunder the coasts or to conquer
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: other lands. Between 800 and 900 A.D., when the Danes were invading
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: England, many were driven from Norway because they refused to submit
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: to a king called Harold Fairhair, and when he pursued them to the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Orkney and Faroe Islands they took refuge on the coasts of Iceland.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: There they settled, built themselves wooden houses, planted such
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: crops as would grow in that bleak land, and founded a commonwealth.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Little by little they left the old Viking life, and it lived only in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: their songs and stories.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: They had come to Iceland with a vast stock of tales in poetry, which
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: were related or sung by professional poets, called skalds, at all
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: kinds of feasts and gatherings. The skalds arranged and improved the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: old stories, but they were not written down until about the time of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: our King Stephen, when some unknown writer collected them into one
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: book called the Elder Edda. Very soon after this another book was
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: written containing the same stories in prose and called the Younger
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: or Prose Edda. In this way many of the old poems, and a great many
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: stories containing much information about the religion which the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: people took with them to Iceland, have been preserved.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But it was from neither of the Eddas that William Morris took his
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: story of Sigurd.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: All through the period from 800 A.D. till about the time of Henry III.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: of England, the skalds had been re-telling many of the poetic stories
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: in prose, and as the people grew more civilised, one tale after
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: another was written down in its new form.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: These prose tales were called Sagas, and among the very greatest is
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the Volsunga Saga, or Story of Sigurd. It is a tale which has been
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: told in other lands besides Iceland. We read part of the same story
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: in the Old English poem of Beowulf, and in Germany it was made into
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: a great poem called the Nibelungenlied. The German musician, Richard
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Wagner, set it to music in a famous series of operas called the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Nibelungen Ring. But his tale differs in many points from that
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: contained in Morris's poem, for Morris chose the old saga as it was
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: written in Iceland, not the German story. On this he founded his poem,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: adding much beautiful description, and greatly lengthening the whole.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: The story deals first with a certain King Volsung, to whose son,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Sigmund, Odin presented a magic sword.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But Siggeir, the jealous king of the Goths, slew Volsung, and took
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Sigmund prisoner that he might have the sword for himself. Only after
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: many toils and perils did Sigmund win it back and reign in his
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: father's kingdom. At last in his old age he fell in battle and the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: sword of Odin was shattered. But his wife, Queen Hiordis, kept the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: fragments for the son who was born to her soon after in Denmark,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: whither she fled for safety. This son of Sigmund and Hiordis was
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Sigurd the Volsung. He was brought up in Denmark and grew strong
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and beautiful, brave, kind of heart, and utterly truthful in word
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and deed.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: When he became a man he longed to win fame and kingship by mighty
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: deeds, and when his tutor told him of a great dragon that guarded a
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: hoard of ill-gotten gold in the mountains, he resolved to kill it. So
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the fragments of Odin's sword were forged into a new blade, and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Sigurd slew the dragon and took the gold, but with it he brought on
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: himself a curse which had been put upon the treasure by the dwarf
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: from whom it had been stolen.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Sigurd then found and wakened Brynhild, a maiden who lay in an
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: enchanted sleep upon a high mountain. They loved one another, and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Sigurd gave her a ring from the dragon's treasure, promising to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: return and marry her.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then the curse led him to join with the fierce and treacherous
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Niblungs or Cloudy People. Their king and his mother grew jealous
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: when they saw Sigurd more mighty and more beloved than themselves,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: and by enchantments they caused him to forget Brynhild, to wed the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: princess Gudrun, and at last to aid the Niblung king, Gunnar, to win
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Brynhild for his own wife.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then the curse of the gold brought death to many, for Sigurd and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Brynhild discovered all the treachery of the Niblungs, who, in their
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: anger, slew Sigurd, and Brynhild killed herself that she might not
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: live and sorrow for him.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Such is the story of Sigurd as it was told a thousand years ago in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: distant Iceland, and as it is retold in this poem by William Morris.

text: There was a dwelling of Kings ere the world was waxen old;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Dukes were the door-wards there, and the roofs were thatched with gold:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Earls were the wrights that wrought it, and silver nailed its doors;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Earls' wives were the weaving-women, queens' daughters strewed its floors,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the masters of its song-craft were the mightiest men that cast
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: The sails of the storm of battle adown the bickering blast.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: There dwelt men merry-hearted, and in hope exceeding great
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Met the good days and the evil as they went the way of fate:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: There the Gods were unforgotten, yea whiles they walked with men,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Though e'en in that world's beginning rose a murmur now and again
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Of the midward time and the fading and the last of the latter days,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the entering in of the terror, and the death of the People's Praise.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Thus was the dwelling of Volsung, the King of the Midworld's Mark,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As a rose in the winter season, a candle in the dark;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And as in all other matters 'twas all earthly houses' crown,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the least of its wall-hung shields was a battle-world's renown,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So therein withal was a marvel and a glorious thing to see,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For amidst of its midmost hall-floor sprang up a mighty tree,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: That reared its blessings roofward, and wreathed the roof-tree dear
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: With the glory of the summer and the garland of the year.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: I know not how they called it ere Volsung changed his life,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But his dawning of fair promise, and his noontide of the strife,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: His eve of the battle-reaping and the garnering of his fame,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Have bred us many a story and named us many a name;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And when men tell of Volsung, they call that war-duke's tree,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: That crowned stem, the Branstock; and so was it told unto me.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So there was the throne of Volsung beneath its blossoming bower,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But high o'er the roof-crest red it rose 'twixt tower and tower,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: Still were its boughs but for them, when lo, on an even of May
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Comes a man from Siggeir the King with a word for his mouth to say:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: "All hail to thee King Volsung, from the King of the Goths I come:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: He hath heard of thy sword victorious and thine abundant home;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: He hath heard of thy sons in the battle, the fillers of Odin's Hall;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And a word hath the west-wind blown him, (full fruitful be its fall!)
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: A word of thy daughter Signy the crown of womanhood:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Now he deems thy friendship goodly, and thine help in the battle good,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And for these will he give his friendship and his battle-aid again:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But if thou wouldst grant his asking, and make his heart full fain,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then shalt thou give him a matter, saith he, without a price,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: --Signy the fairer than fair, Signy the wiser than wise."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Now the message gladdened Volsung and his sons, but no word spake
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Signy, "I will wed the Goth king, and yet shall I rue my lot in his
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: hall." And Volsung urged her with kind words to do nought against her
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: will, but her mind was fixed, and she said she wrought but what the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: to wed the white-handed Signy and bear her home.

text: I bid thee now King Volsung, and these thy glorious sons,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And thine earls and thy dukes of battle and all thy mighty ones,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: To come to the house of the Goth-kings as honoured guests and dear
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And abide the winter over; that the dusky days and drear
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: May be glorious with thy presence, that all folk may praise my life,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the friends that my fame hath gotten; and that this my new-wed wife
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Thine eyes may make the merrier till she bear my eldest born."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then speedily answered Volsung: "No king of the earth might scorn
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Such noble bidding, Siggeir; and surely will I come
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: To look upon thy glory and the Goths' abundant home.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But let two months wear over, for I have many a thing
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: To shape and shear in the Woodland, as befits a people's king:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And thou meanwhile here abiding of all my goods shalt be free,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And then shall we twain together roof over the glass-green sea
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: With the sides of our golden dragons; and our war-hosts' blended shields
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Shall fright the sea-abiders and the folk of the fishy fields."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Answered the smooth-speeched Siggeir: "I thank thee well for this,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And thy bidding is most kingly; yet take it not amiss
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: That I wend my ways in the morning; for we Goth-folk know indeed
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: That the sea is a foe full deadly, and a friend that fails at need."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And for all the words of Volsung e'en so must the matter be,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And Siggeir the Goth and Signy on the morn shall sail the sea.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then the feast sped on the fairer, far into the night, but amidst the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: mirth Sigmund and Signy were sad at heart. And before the sun was
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: risen next day Signy came to her father in secret and begged him to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: stay in his own country rather than trust the guileful heart and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: murder-loving hand of Siggeir. But Volsung answered that he must go
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: to be Siggeir's guest, for he could not break his pledged word
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: through fear of peril. So on the morrow the smooth-speeched Siggeir
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: departed with Signy, and when two months were passed Volsung made
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: ready to visit them.

author: Morris, William

text: So now, when all things were ready, in the first of the autumn tide
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Adown unto the swan-bath the Volsung Children ride;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And lightly go a shipboard, a goodly company,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Though the tale thereof be scanty and their ships no more than three:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But kings' sons dealt with the sail-sheets and earls and dukes of war
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Were the halers of the hawsers and the tuggers at the oar.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But when the sun on the morrow shone over earth and sea
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Ashore went the Volsung Children a goodly company,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And toward King Siggeir's dwelling o'er heath and holt they went.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But when they came to the topmost of a certain grassy bent,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Lo there lay the land before them as thick with shield and spear
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As the rich man's wealthiest acre with the harvest of the year.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: There bade King Volsung tarry and dight the wedge-array;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: "For duly," he said, "doeth Siggeir to meet his guests by the way."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So shield by shield they serried, nor ever hath been told
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Of any host of battle more glorious with the gold;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And there stood the high King Volsung in the very front of war;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And lovelier was his visage than ever heretofore,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As he rent apart the peace-strings that his brand of battle bound
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the bright blade gleamed to the heavens, and he cast the sheath to the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: ground.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then up the steep came the Goth-folk, and the spear-wood drew anigh,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And earth's face shook beneath them, yet cried they never a cry;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the Volsungs stood all silent, although forsooth at whiles
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: O'er the faces grown earth-weary would play the flickering smiles,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And swords would clink and rattle: not long had they to bide,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For soon that flood of murder flowed round the hillock-side;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then at last the edges mingled, and if men forbore the shout,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Yet the din of steel and iron in the grey clouds rang about;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But how to tell of King Volsung, and the valour of his folk!
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Three times the wood of battle before their edges broke;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the shield-wall, sorely dwindled and reft of the ruddy gold,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Against the drift of the war-blast for the fourth time yet did hold.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But men's shields were waxen heavy with the weight of shafts they bore,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the fifth time many a champion cast earthward Odin's door
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And gripped the sword two-handed; and in sheaves the spears came on.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And at last the host of the Goth-folk within the shield-wall won,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And wild was the work within it, and oft and o'er again
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Forth brake the sons of Volsung, and drave the foe in vain;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For the driven throng still thickened, till it might not give aback.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But fast abode King Volsung amid the shifting wrack
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: In the place where once was the forefront: for he said: "My feet are old,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And if I wend on further there is nought more to behold
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Than this that I see about me."--Whiles drew his foes away
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And stared across the corpses that before his sword-edge lay.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But nought he followed after: then needs must they in front
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Thrust on by the thickening spear-throng come up to bear the brunt,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Till all his limbs were weary and his body rent and torn:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then he cried: "Lo now, Allfather, is not the swathe well shorn?
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Wouldst thou have me toil for ever, nor win the wages due?"
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And mid the hedge of foemen his blunted sword he threw,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And, laid like the oars of a longship the level war-shafts pressed
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: On 'gainst the unshielded elder, and clashed amidst his breast;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And dead he fell, thrust backward, and rang on the dead men's gear:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But still for a certain season durst no man draw anear,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For 'twas e'en as a great God's slaying, and they feared the wrath of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the sky;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And they deemed their hearts might harden if awhile they should let him lie.

author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: _Of the ending of all Volsung's Sons save Sigmund only, and of how
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: he abideth in the wild wood._
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: They joined battle again, but the fight grew feeble after Volsung
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: fell, and his earls were struck down one by one. Last of all, his sons
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: were borne to earth and carried captive to the hall, where Siggeir
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: awaited them, for he himself had feared to face the Volsung swords.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then he would have slain them at once without torture, but Signy
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: besought him that they might breathe the earthly air a day or two
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: before their death, and he listened to her, for he saw how he might
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: thus give them greater pain. He bade his men lead them to a glade in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the forest and fetter them to the mightiest tree that grew there. So
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the ten Volsungs were fettered with iron to a great oak, and on the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: morrow Siggeir's woodmen told him sweet tidings, for beasts of the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: wood had devoured two and left their bones in the fetters. So it
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: befell every night till the woodmen brought word that nothing
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: remained of the king's foemen save their bones in the fetters that
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: had bound them.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Now a watch had been set on Signy lest she should send help to her
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: brethren, but henceforth no man hindered her from going out to the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: wood. So that night she came to the glade in the forest, and saw in
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the midst of it a mighty man who was toiling to dig a grave in the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: greensward.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And behold, it was Sigmund the Volsung: but she cried and had no fear:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: "If thou art living, Sigmund, what day's work dost thou here
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: In the midnight and the forest? but if thou art nought but a ghost
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then where are those Volsung brethren, of whom thou wert best and most?"
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then he turned about unto her, and his raiment was fouled and torn,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And his eyen were great and hollow, as a famished man forlorn;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But he cried: "Hail, Sister Signy! I looked for thee before,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Though what should a woman compass, she one alone and no more,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: When all we shielded Volsungs did nought in Siggeir's land?
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: O yea, I am living indeed, and this labour of mine hand
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Is to bury the bones of the Volsungs; and lo, it is well-nigh done.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So draw near, Volsung's daughter, and pile we many a stone
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Where lie the grey wolf's gleanings of what was once so good."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So she set her hand to the labour, and they toiled, they twain in the wood,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And when the work was over, dead night was beginning to fall:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then spake the white-hand Signy: "Now shall thou tell the tale
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Of the death of the Volsung brethren ere the wood thy wrath shall hide,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Ere I wend me back sick-hearted in the dwelling of kings to abide."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then said Sigmund:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: "We lay fettered to the tree and at midnight there came from the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: thicket two mighty wood-wolves, and falling on my brethren Gylfi and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Geirmund, they devoured them in their bonds, and turned again to the
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: forest. Night after night, my sister, this befell, till I was left
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: alone with our brother Sigi to await the wood-beasts. Then came
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: midnight, and one of the wolves fell upon Sigi and the other turned
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: on me. But I met it with snarling like its own, and my teeth gripped
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: its throat, and my hands strove with the fetters till they burst. So
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: I slew the beast with my irons, but when I looked, Sigi lay dead, and
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: the other wolf had fled again to the thicket. Then I lay hid till
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Siggeir's woodmen had looked on the place and departed with their
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: tidings, and as I beheld them I knew that pity was killed in my
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: heart, and that henceforward I should live but to avenge me on him
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: who hath so set the gods at nought." Then Signy spake noble words of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: comfort, saying: "I wot well that Siggeir shall pay the due price of
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: his deeds, though the vengeance may tarry long, and I wot also that
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: thy life shall yet know gladness. Bear a stout heart, therefore, to
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: meet the waiting time, and make thee a lair in the woods whence thou
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: mayest fall on men of the Goth-folk, and win what thy life needeth.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: wot where thou dwellest and then must we meet no more."

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

author: Morris, William

text: So wrought is the will of King Siggeir, and he weareth Odin's sword
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And it lies on his knees in the council and hath no other lord:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: And nought but his will she doeth, nor raiseth a word of strife;

author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Of all the lords of the cunning that teacheth how to prevail.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: hidden in a thicket by the river-side.

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: will."

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: And the joy of the people waxeth and their glad cry goeth up.

author: Morris, William

text: But again came the girded maidens: earls' daughters pour the wine,

author: Morris, William

text: To beseech no man for his helping, and to vex no God with prayer;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And to seek out the will of the Norns, and look in the eyes of the curse;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And to laugh while the love aboundeth, lest the glad world grow into worse;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then if in the murder I laugh not, O Earth, remember my name,

author: Morris, William

text: And oft tell it aloud to the people for the Niblungs' fated shame!"
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: Then he drank of the Cup of the Promise, and all men hearkened and deemed

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: And empty it lieth before them; for the child hath wearied of peace,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And he sits by the oars in the East-seas, and winneth fame's increase.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Nor then, nor ever after, o'er the Holy Beast he spake,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: When mighty hearts were exalted for the golden Sigurd's sake.

text: _Sigurd rideth with the Niblungs, and wooeth Brynhild for King Gunnar._
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Now it fell on a day of the spring-tide that followed on these things,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: That Sigurd fares to the meadows with Gunnar and Hogni the Kings;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For afar is Guttorm the youngest, and he sails the Eastern Seas,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And fares with war-shield hoisted to win him fame's increase.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: There stay those Kings of the people alone in weed of war,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And loosen it clean in the midst, while its ends in the earth abide;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William
