author: Morris, William

text: An ancient spear of battle writ round with words of worth;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And these are the posts of the door, whose threshold is of the earth,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the skin of the earth is its lintel: but with war-glaives gleaming bare
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: The Niblung Kings and Sigurd beneath the earth-yoke fare;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then each an arm-vein openeth, and their blended blood falls down
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: On Earth the fruitful Mother where they rent her turfy gown:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And then, when the blood of the Volsungs hath run with the Niblung blood,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: They kneel with their hands upon it and swear the brotherhood:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Each man at his brother's bidding to come with the blade in his hand,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Though the fire and the flood should sunder, and the very Gods withstand:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Each man to love and cherish his brother's hope and will;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Each man to avenge his brother when the Norns his fate fulfill:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And now are they foster-brethren, and in such wise have they sworn
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As the God-born Goths of aforetime, when the world was newly born.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But among the folk of the Niblungs goes forth the tale of the same,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And men deem the tidings a glory and the garland of their fame.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So is Sigurd yet with the Niblungs, and he loveth Gudrun his wife,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And wendeth afield with the brethren to the days of the dooming of life;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And nought his glory waneth, nor falleth the flood of praise:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: To every man he hearkeneth, nor gainsayeth any grace,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And glad is the poor in the Doom-ring when he seeth his face mid the Kings,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For the tangle straighteneth before him, and the maze of crooked things.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But the smile is departed from him, and the laugh of Sigurd the young,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And of few words now is he waxen, and his songs are seldom sung.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Howbeit of all the sad-faced was Sigurd loved the best;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And men say: Is the king's heart mighty beyond all hope of rest?
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Lo, how he beareth the people! how heavy their woes are grown!
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So oft were a God mid the Goth-folk, if he dwelt in the world alone.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Now Giuki the king was long grown old, and he died and was buried
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: beneath a great earth-mound high on the mountains.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So there lieth Giuki the King, mid steel and the glimmer of gold,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As the sound of the feastful Niblungs round his misty house is rolled:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But Gunnar is King of the people, and the chief of the Niblung land;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: A man beloved for his mercy, and his might and his open hand;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: A glorious king in the battle, a hearkener at the doom,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: A singer to sing the sun up from the heart of the midnight gloom.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: On a day sit the Kings in the high-seat when Grimhild saith to her son:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: "O Gunnar, King beloved, a fair life hast thou won;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: On the flood, in the field hast thou wrought, and hung the chambers with
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: gold;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Far abroad mid many a people are the tidings of thee told:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Now do a deed for thy mother and the hallowed Niblung hearth,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Lest the house of the mighty perish, and our tale grow wan with dearth.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: If thou do the deed that I bid thee, and wed a wife of the Kings,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: No less shalt thou cleave the war-helms and scatter the ruddy rings."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: He said: "Meseemeth, mother, thou speakest not in haste,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But hast sought and found beforehand, lest thy fair words fall to waste."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: She said: "Thou sayest the sooth; I have found the thing I sought:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: A Maid for thee is shapen, and a Queen for thee is wrought:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: In the waste land hard by Lymdale a marvellous hall is built,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: With its roof of the red gold beaten, and its wall-stones over-gilt:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Afar o'er the heath men see it, but no man draweth nigher,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For the garth that goeth about it is nought but the roaring fire,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: A white wall waving aloft; and no window nor wicket is there,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Whereby the shielded earl-folk or the sons of the merchants may fare:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But few things from me are hidden, and I know in that hall of gold
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Sits Brynhild, white as a wild-swan where the foamless seas are rolled;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the daughter of Kings of the world, and the sister of Queens is she,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And wise, and Odin's Chooser, and the Breath of Victory:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But for this cause sitteth she thus in the ring of the Wavering Flame,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: That no son of the Kings will she wed save the mightiest master of fame,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the man who knoweth not fear, and the man foredoomed of fate
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: To ride through her Wavering Fire to the door of her golden gate:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And for him she sitteth and waiteth, and him shall she cherish and love,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Though the Kings of the world should withstand it, and the Gods that sit
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: above.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Speak thou, O mighty Gunnar!--nay rather, Sigurd my son,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Say who but the lord of the Niblungs should wed with this glorious one?"
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Long Sigurd gazeth upon her, and slow he sayeth again:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: "I know thy will, my mother; of all the sons of men,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Of all the Kings unwedded, and the kindred of the great,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: It is meet that my brother Gunnar should ride to her golden gate."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: But or ever they leap to the saddle, while yet in the door they stand,

author: Morris, William

text: Thereto cometh Grimhild the wise-wife, and on each head layeth her hand,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As she saith: "Be mighty and wise, as the kings that came before!
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: For they knew of the ways of the Gods, and the craft of the Gods they bore:

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: Of the hearts that abide within them, and they knew of the shaping of these.

author: Morris, William

text: Be wise and mighty, O Kings, and look in mine heart and behold

author: Morris, William

text: The craft that prevaileth o'er semblance, and the treasured wisdom of old!
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: I hallow you thus for the day, and I hallow you thus for the night,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And I hallow you thus for the dawning with my fathers' hidden might.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Go now, for ye bear my will while I sit in the hall and spin;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And tonight shall be the weaving, and tomorn the web shall ye win."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So they leap to the saddles aloft, and they ride and speak no word,

author: Morris, William

text: But the hills and the dales are awakened by the clink of the sheathed sword:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: None looks in the face of the other, but the earth and the heavens gaze,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And behold those kings of battle ride down the dusty ways.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So they come to the Waste of Lymdale when the afternoon is begun,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And afar they see the flame-blink on the grey sky under the sun:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And they spur and speak no word, and no man to his fellow will turn;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But they see the hills draw upward and the earth beginning to burn:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And they ride, and the eve is coming, and the sun hangs low o'er the earth,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the red flame roars up to it from the midst of the desert's dearth.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: None turns or speaks to his brother, but the Wrath gleams bare and red,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And blood-red is the Helm of Aweing on the golden Sigurd's head,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And bare is the blade of Gunnar, and the first of the three he rides,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the wavering wall is before him and the golden sun it hides.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then the heart of a king's son failed not, but he tossed his sword on high
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And laughed as he spurred for the fire, and cried the Niblung cry;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: That so oft had pierced the spear-hedge and never failed at need,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: Fled fast as the foals unbitted on Odin's pasturing plain;

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: And the voice of a lord beloved, till the steed his master felt,

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: In the pastures of King Giuki; but since thine heart fails not,

author: Morris, William

text: And thou wouldst not get thee backward and say, The fire was hot,

author: Morris, William

text: And the voices pent within it were singing nought but death,

author: Morris, William

text: Let Sigurd lend thee his steed that wore the Glittering Heath,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And carried the Bed of the Serpent, and the ancient ruddy rings.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: So perchance may the mocks be lesser when men tell of the Niblung Kings."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then Sigurd looked on the twain, and he saw their swart hair wave
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: In the wind of the waste and the flame-blast, and no answer awhile he gave.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: That hath not its like in the heavens nor has earth of its fellow told:

author: Morris, William

text: For this is the raiment of Kings when they ride the Flickering Fire,

author: Morris, William

text: And so sink the flames before them and the might of their desire."
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then Hogni laughed in his heart, and he said: "This changing were well

author: Morris, William

text: If so might the deed be accomplished; but perchance there is more to tell:

author: Morris, William

text: Thou shalt take the war-steed, Gunnar, and enough or nought it shall be:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: But the coal-blue gear of the Niblungs the golden hall shall see."

author: Morris, William

text: As he stood in the gold red-litten with the Wrath's thin edges bared.

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And her bed is dight by Sigurd's; then he sinks the pale white blade
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And lays it 'twixt the sleepers, and leaves them there alone--
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: He, the last that shall ever behold them,--and his days are well nigh done.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then is silence over the plain; in the noon shine the torches pale
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As the best of the Niblung Earl-folk bear fire to the builded bale:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Then a wind in the west ariseth, and the white flames leap on high,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And with one voice crieth the people a great and mighty cry,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And men cast up hands to the Heavens, and pray without a word,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: As they that have seen God's visage, and the voice of the Father have heard.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: They are gone--the lovely, the mighty, the hope of the ancient Earth:
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: It shall labour and bear the burden as before that day of their birth.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Ye have heard of Sigurd aforetime, how the foes of God he slew;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: How forth from the darksome desert the Gold of the Waters he drew;
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: How he wakened Love on the Mountain, and wakened Brynhild the Bright,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And dwelt upon Earth for a season and shone in all men's sight.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: Ye have heard of the Cloudy People, and the dimming of the day,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: And the latter world's confusion, and Sigurd gone away.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: _Shield-burg_, a fortress built of shields. Burg means either a town,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: a castle, or a fortress.

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: close together as they stand at bay.

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: _Shift_, n. a trick, cunning plan, e.g. "my cunning shifts;" n.
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
author: Morris, William

text: to contrive, be able, e.g. "the man whose heart and hand may shift,
title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung

text: To pluck it from the oak-wood."

text: is now grown cold.

text: because of his skill in deceit.

title: The Story of Sigurd the Volsung
